BTW, in case you don't believe the government can turn on its 
citizens, click on the link below.  In the depths of the Great 
Depression, the price of gold started to rise despite the 
deflationary times.  A number of people sought the precious metal as 
a solid store of value.  In 1933, FDR outlawed the private ownership 
of gold (which was called "hoarding" in the executive order - spin is 
no recent phenonemon!), and, after all the gold was sucked up by the 
government for paper dollars, FDR devalued those dollars by re-
pegging the price of gold from $20.67 to $35 an ounce!  Here's the 
Presidential order:

http://tinyurl.com/m8dg

BTW, the order is still on the books, just temporarily rescinded, and 
can be re-implemented at any time.  So if you believe that the Fed 
has pumped too much money into the economy and roaring inflation is 
around the corner, and have bought gold to hedge this, be aware that 
the gubbermint is ready, willing and able to yank your life preserver 
away.  Too bad, so sad, glub-glub-glub!

NC
